title: EU agrees to delay Brexit until January next year
text:
EU Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier arrives at the European Commission to meet members this morning (Picture: Reuters)

Britain will remain in the European Union until next year unless Parliament formally agrees to Boris Johnson’s Brexit deal sooner.

At a meeting of EU ambassadors this morning, members agreed to accept the UK’s request for a Brexit extension until 31 January.

Donald Tusk confirmed that the delay will be a ‘flextension’ – meaning the UK could still leave before that date if a deal is ratified.

He tweeted: ‘The EU27 has agreed that it will accept the UK’s request for a #Brexit flextension until 31 January 2020.

‘The decision is expected to be formalised through a written procedure.’

Boris Johnson has said in the past he would prefer to be ‘dead in a ditch’ than miss the 31 October deadline.

European Council President Donald Tusk confirmed the extension (Picture: AP)

This is a breaking story we will be updating.
